content: आचार्यः [आ-चर्-ण्यत् <ls>P. VI. 2. 36</ls>] {@--1@} A teacher or preceptor (in general). {@--2@} A spiritual guide or preceptor, holy teacher (one who invests a boy with the sacred thread, instructs him in the Vedas &c.); उपनीय तु यः शिष्यं वेदमध्यापयेत् द्विजः . सकल्पं सरहस्यं च तमाचार्यं प्रचक्षते <ls>Ms. 2. 140</ls>, see अध्यापक also. {@--3@} One who propounds a particular doctrine. {@--4@} (When affixed to proper names) Learned, venerable (somewhat like the English Dr.). {@--5@} An adviser or preceptor at a sacrifice &c. {@--6@} An epithet of Droṇa. --र्या A female preceptor, a spiritual preceptress.
